artists.biography: Tim Bowness is a british singer/songwriter primarily known for his work as part of the band No-Man, a long-term project with Steven Wilson from Porcupine Tree and the co-founder of the music distribution label BurningShed In addition to producing several albums with No-Man, Tim has recorded with popular Italian artist Alice, experimental guitar legend David Torn, Soft Machine's Hugh Hopper, Roger Eno, German band Centrozoon, BurningShed co-founder Peter Chilvers and recorded the album Flame (1994) in collaboration with Porcupine Tree/ex-Japan keyboard player Richard Barbieri. Tim's debut solo album, My Hotel Year, was released on the One Little Indian label in 2004. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
